title: Snap decisions: why crowding into a photo booth with friends is still a magical experience | Nova Weetman
content: Whenever I’m out late with friends and we pass a photo booth, I drag them in so I can add to the gallery of faces I love seeing each day Last New Year’s Eve, I was out with a friend. We had no plans, so we met at a local cinema and then wandered the long street between our houses, pausing for a drink or two in various bars and chatting to strangers doing the same. We stopped when we became hungry and shared a plate of curries and drank beer in the window of an Indian restaurant, watching the par...
creator: Nova Weetman
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice

title: Europe faces a pincer attack from White House ideologues backed by Silicon Valley and its far-right proxies | Armida van Rij
content: US tech bosses are exerting leverage on EU regulators via Trump and Vance. But Europe isn’t powerless, and it isn’t alone The US is advancing a new global order. Over the past eight decades Washington pursued – when it suited American interests – an order based on international law, liberalism, multilateralism and democratic values. The new one is based on autocracy and the use of force, and is underpinned by xenophobic nationalism. For the transatlantic relationship this is transformative: it m...
creator: Armida van Rij
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice

title: When the AI bubble bursts, humans will finally have their chance to take back control | Rafael Behr
content: The US economy is pumped up on tech-bro vanity. The inevitable correction must prompt a global conversation about intelligent machines, regulation and risk If AI did not change your life in 2025, next year it will. That is one of few forecasts that can be made with confidence in unpredictable times. This is not an invitation to believe the hype about what the technology can do today, or may one day achieve. The hype doesn’t need your credence. It is puffed up enough on Silicon Valley finance to ...
creator: Rafael Behr
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice

title: The fight to see clearly through big tech’s echo chambers
content: As Silicon Valley tightens its grip on the narrative, insiders and regulators push back, consumers rethink upgrades, and states experiment with AI in the public sector Hello, and welcome to TechScape. I’m your host, Blake Montgomery. Today, I’m mulling over whether to upgrade my iPhone 11 Pro. In tech news, there’s a narrative battle afoot in Silicon Valley, tips on avoiding the yearly smartphone upgrade cycle and new devices altogether, and artificial intelligence’s use in government, for bette...
creator: Blake Montgomery
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice

title: How big tech is creating its own friendly media bubble to ‘win the narrative battle online’
content: At a time when distrust of big tech is high, Silicon Valley is embracing an alternative ecosystem where every CEO is a star A montage of Palantir’s CEO, Alex Karp, and waving US flags set to a remix of AC/DC’s Thunderstruck blasts out as the intro for the tech billionaire’s interview with Sourcery, a YouTube show presented by the digital finance platform Brex. Over the course of a friendly walk through the company offices, Karp fields no questions about Palantir’s controversial ties to ICE but i...
creator: Nick Robins-Early
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice

title: Clickbait review – gripping drama about the human cost of moderating the internet
content: A social media content moderator becomes obsessed with a violent video in this restrained, unsettling workplace thriller starring Lili Reinhart Here is a workplace drama, of sorts. Like many people, Daisy (Lili Reinhart) works a desk job using a computer. Unlike most people, fainting at work is a rite of passage; she moderates videos on social media that have been reported for violating the terms of service. That means watching everything from horrible porn to horrible politics to horrible accid...
creator: Catherine Bray
sourceDescription: Latest Technology news, comment and analysis from the Guardian, the world's leading liberal voice
